page.title: 05ST. INGUNGER FARM 1
page.content: The farmer, Mr. Kendall and his family, have lived there for 14 years and employ 2 men. Its name is derived from St. Congar, who was connected with St. Petroc. There was a well bering his name, but only the site remains. It is a dairy farm, and the complete farm holding comprises of 520 acres. St. Ingunger (260 acres) is rented from Lanhydrock Estate and a further 260 acres is owned by Mr. Kendall. 200 acres provides 2,000 tons of silage - 85 acres winter barley - 50 acres hay and 9 acres each of kale and turnips, for extra winter feed. The rest is pasture with additional grass-keep rented on a yearly basis. The livestock comprises of:- 217 pedigree fresians 2 hereford bulls
